artifact.content: User makes a phone call by dialing a phone number
User picks up phone when it rings
System detects a off hook phone
Should be able to open an audio connection to allow two users to talk to each other
The caller dials an invalid number which is detected by the system
The caller dials a line that is busy
Maximum connections have been reached
System must maintain a mapping from all phone numbers of clients to IP addresses
User should be able to hang up at any time without breaking the system
Users should be able to make long distance calls
System should be able to handle unanswered calls
Administrators must be able to login to the system console using a login name and password
Administrators must be able to get user account information
Administrators must be able to obtain an available phone number
Administrator must be able to create a new account for a new user
Administrator must be able to delete a user
Administrator must be able to change a user�s info (user name and address)
Administrator must be able to cancel a user account
Administrator must be able to suspend an account
Administrator must be able to unsuspend an account
The IP address can be unmapped from the phone number
The IP address of a particular phone number can be changed
Verify that the user�s phone is connected to the system
Able to remove a phone from the system
Reset the status of a particular phone
Able to determine whether all phones are optimal
Administrator can set the maximum number of calls in the system
Administrator can change amounts charged for calls by editing existing billing plans on the system console
Administrator can change amounts charged for calls by adding new billing plans on the system console
Administrator can set a billing plan for a customer on the system console
Administrator can reset the outstanding billing balance for a customer to zero.
Administrator can set the discount rate for each period
Administrator can remove a billing plan from the system console
Administrator can change which plan a user subscribes to
The system must perform with a low response time.
The system must be easy to pick up and use.
The system must be maintainable.
The system must be secured.
The system must be portable.
The system must be scalable.
The system should function in a stable state.
The system should have a low cost.
